Module.Name: Grove Slide Potentiometer
Module.Overview: This slide potentiometer is a linear variable resistor with a total resistance of 10k. When you move the lever from one side to the other, its output voltage will range between 0 V to the VCC you apply. Three of four Grove pins are connected to VCC, GND and the ADC IN on the slide, while the remaining pin is connected to a green indicator LED. You can use the indicator LED to visually display the change on the potentiometer.

Register.Name: duty_cycle
Register.Description: This register specifes the on duty cycle as a percentage value between 0 and 100. 0 means totally off and 100 means totally on.

Register.Name: frequency
Register.Description: This register specifes the refresh frequency in Hertz (cycles per second) as a value between 1 and 1000. A frequency value of 0 means the LED is off. A value of 1 means the LED is cycled at 1 Hertz. A value of 1000 means the LED is cycled at 1000 Hertz.

Function.Name: value get
Function.Description: This function returns the current potentiometer values as a number between 0 and 1023.
